thread.title: Vote now: How would you rate the Cup Series race at Atlanta?
thread.title_full: Vote now: How would you rate the Cup Series race at Atlanta?

title: Vote now: How would you rate the Cup Series race at Atlanta?
text:
Mar 6, 2017 at 11:47a ET 0Shares 
Brad Keselowski benefited from Kevin Harvick’s late-race pit road speeding penalty and passed Kyle Larson with seven laps to go to win the Folds of Honor QuikTrip 500 at Atlanta Motor Speedway. 
The race was dominated by Kevin Harvick before the penalty with the No. 4 Stewart-Haas Racing Ford leading 293 laps. Harvick wasn’t alone with the pit road speeding penalties as that served as one of the themes throughout the race. 
We want to know what you thought of the Monster Energy Cup Series race at Atlanta Motor Speedway. Was it a great race? Or did you get tired of Kevin Harvick’s dominance throughout the race? 
Let us know your thoughts and vote below.
